p: The dry capitulum of Chrysanthemum morifolium Ramat. (Compositae) is a popular traditional Chinese medicine known as ‘Ju Hua’ in China, that is included in the Chinese Pharmacopoeia as Chrysanthemi Flos (Chinese Pharmacopoeia Commission 2015). It is also widely used as an herbal tea, beverage and seasoning due to its unique flavour, colour and health benefits (Lii et al. 2010). Pharmacological studies have shown that C. morifolium possesses multiple activities, and its antioxidant activity is of greatest interest. Indeed, several studies have reported that C. morifolium extracts have antioxidant activity (Chen et al. 2015; Yuan et al. 2015). Oxidative stress is the common mechanism of many cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk factors, which suggests that it plays a central role in CVD (Madamanchi et al. 2005).
